use_cases.title: Create Task
use_cases.description: A user creates a new task in the task management app, including task details such as title, description, and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to create tasks

main_flow.step: User enters task title and description

use_cases.postconditions: Task is created and displayed in the task list
use_cases.business_value: Allows users to create new tasks and prioritize their work

use_cases.title: Assign Task
use_cases.description: A user assigns a task to another user in the task management app, including assigning task details such as due date and responsible user.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to assign tasks

main_flow.step: User enters responsible user and due date

use_cases.postconditions: Task is assigned to the responsible user and displayed in their task list
use_cases.business_value: Enables collaboration and task delegation among team members

use_cases.title: Prioritize Task
use_cases.description: A user prioritizes a task in the task management app using AI-powered algorithms, including selecting task priority and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to prioritize tasks

main_flow.step: User selects priority and due date

use_cases.postconditions: Task is prioritized and displayed in the task list with updated priority
use_cases.business_value: Improves task management and reduces task complexity

use_cases.title: View Task Details
use_cases.description: A user views task details in the task management app, including task title, description, and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to view task details
use_cases.postconditions: Task details are displayed and user can take actions
use_cases.business_value: Provides users with task information and enables them to take actions

use_cases.title: Delete Task
use_cases.description: A user deletes a task in the task management app, including deleting task details such as title and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to delete tasks
use_cases.postconditions: Task is deleted and displayed as deleted
use_cases.business_value: Removes unnecessary tasks and improves task management

business_requirements.overview: The Task Management App is designed to provide a comprehensive task management system for teams, enabling collaboration, task delegation, and task prioritization.
business_goals: Enhance collaboration and communication among team members
Reduce task complexity and improve task management
success_criteria: Task creation and assignment rates increase by 30%
User satisfaction with task management app increases by 25%
Task complexity and management improve by 20%
constraints: Limited budget for development and maintenance
Technical constraints due to integration with existing systems
assumptions: Users will have permission to create and assign tasks
Users will have permission to prioritize tasks
risks: Limited user adoption due to complexity
Technical issues due to integration with existing systems

prd.prd_xml:
Here is the PRD XML document for the Task Management App:

```xml
<productRequirementsDocument>
    <title>PRD for Task Management App</title>
    <executiveSummary>A comprehensive task management system for teams, enabling collaboration, task delegation, and task prioritization.</executiveSummary>
    <scope>
        <inScope>A list of features in scope for the MVP, including task creation, assignment, prioritization, and deletion.</inScope>
        <outOfScope>A list of features explicitly out of scope, including advanced reporting and analytics.</outOfScope>
    </scope>
    <businessGoals>
        <goal>Improve team productivity and efficiency</goal>
        <goal>Enhance collaboration and communication among team members</goal>
        <goal>Reduce task complexity and improve task management</goal>
    </businessGoals>
    <useCases>
        <useCaseModel>
            <useCase id="UC-001">
                <title>Create Task</title>
                <description>A user creates a new task in the task management app, including task details such as title, description, and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to create tasks</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User enters task title and description</step>
                    <step>User selects due date</step>
                    <step>User saves task</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows/>
                <postconditions>Task is created and displayed in the task list</postconditions>
                <priority>high</priority>
                <businessValue>Allows users to create new tasks and prioritize their work</businessValue>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-002">
                <title>Assign Task</title>
                <description>A user assigns a task to another user in the task management app, including assigning task details such as due date and responsible user.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to assign tasks</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User selects task to assign</step>
                    <step>User enters responsible user and due date</step>
                    <step>User saves assignment</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows/>
                <postconditions>Task is assigned to the responsible user and displayed in their task list</postconditions>
                <priority>high</priority>
                <businessValue>Enables collaboration and task delegation among team members</businessValue>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-003">
                <title>Prioritize Task</title>
                <description>A user prioritizes a task in the task management app using AI-powered algorithms, including selecting task priority and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to prioritize tasks</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User selects task to prioritize</step>
                    <step>User selects priority and due date</step>
                    <step>User saves priority</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows/>
                <postconditions>Task is prioritized and displayed in the task list with updated priority</postconditions>
                <priority>high</priority>
                <businessValue>Improves task management and reduces task complexity</businessValue>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-004">
                <title>View Task Details</title>
                <description>A user views task details in the task management app, including task title, description, and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to view task details</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User selects task to view</step>
                    <step>Task details are displayed</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows/>
                <postconditions>Task details are displayed and user can take actions</postconditions>
                <priority>medium</priority>
                <businessValue>Provides users with task information and enables them to take actions</businessValue>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-005">
                <title>Delete Task</title>
                <description>A user deletes a task in the task management app, including deleting task details such as title and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to delete tasks</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User selects task to delete</step>
                    <step>User confirms deletion</step>
                    <step>Task is deleted</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows/>
                <postconditions>Task is deleted and displayed as deleted</postconditions>
                <priority>high</priority>
                <businessValue>Removes unnecessary tasks and improves task management</businessValue>
            </useCase>
        </useCaseModel>
    </useCases>
    <nonFunctionalRequirements>
        <requirement type="Security">All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Performance">The system must respond to 95% of user queries in under 2 seconds.</requirement>
    </nonFunctionalRequirements>
</productRequirementsDocument>
```

This PRD XML document includes the following sections:

*   `title`: The title of the PRD document.
*   `executiveSummary`: A brief summary of the project's purpose and scope.
*   `scope`: A list of features in scope for the MVP and features explicitly out of scope.
*   `businessGoals`: A list of business goals for the project.
*   `useCases`: A list of use cases for the project, including their descriptions, actors, preconditions, main flows, alternate flows, postconditions, priorities, and business values.
*   `nonFunctionalRequirements`: A list of non-functional requirements for the project, including security and performance requirements.

Note that this is a sample PRD XML document and may need to be modified to fit the specific needs of your project.
prd.prd_html:
Here is the transformed PRD XML document into a beautiful, professional HTML document: ```html PRD for Task Management App

PRD for Task Management App

Executive Summary:

A comprehensive task management system for teams, enabling collaboration, task delegation, and task prioritization.

Scope

In Scope:

  • Task creation
  • Task assignment
  • Task prioritization
  • Task deletion

Out of Scope:

  • Advanced reporting and analytics

Business Goals

  • Improve team productivity and efficiency
  • Enhance collaboration and communication among team members
  • Reduce task complexity and improve task management

Use Cases

  • Create Task

    A user creates a new task in the task management app, including task details such as title, description, and due date.

    Actors:

    • User

    Preconditions:

    • User is logged in and has permission to create tasks

    Main Flow:

    1. User enters task title and description
    2. User selects due date
    3. User saves task

    Alternate Flows:

    Postconditions:

    • Task is created and displayed in the task list

    Priority:

    High

    Business Value:

    Allows users to create new tasks and prioritize their work

  • Assign Task

    A user assigns a task to another user in the task management app, including assigning task details such as due date and responsible user.

    Actors:

    • User

    Preconditions:

    • User is logged in and has permission to assign tasks

    Main Flow:

    1. User selects task to assign
    2. User enters responsible user and due date
    3. User saves assignment

    Alternate Flows:

    Postconditions:

    • Task is assigned to the responsible user and displayed in their task list

    Priority:

    High

    Business Value:

    Enables collaboration and task delegation among team members

  • Prioritize Task

    A user prioritizes a task in the task management app using AI-powered algorithms, including selecting task priority and due date.

    Actors:

    • User

    Preconditions:

    • User is logged in and has permission to prioritize tasks

    Main Flow:

    1. User selects task to prioritize
    2. User selects priority and due date
    3. User saves priority

    Alternate Flows:

    Postconditions:

    • Task is prioritized and displayed in the task list with updated priority

    Priority:

    High

    Business Value:

    Improves task management and reduces task complexity

  • View Task Details

    A user views task details in the task management app, including task title, description, and due date.

    Actors:

    • User

    Preconditions:

    • User is logged in and has permission to view task details

    Main Flow:

    1. User selects task to view
    2. Task details are displayed

    Alternate Flows:

    Postconditions:

    • Task details are displayed and user can take actions

    Priority:

    Medium

    Business Value:

    Provides users with task information and enables them to take actions

  • Delete Task

    A user deletes a task in the task management app, including deleting task details such as title and due date.

    Actors:

    • User

    Preconditions:

    • User is logged in and has permission to delete tasks

    Main Flow:

    1. User selects task to delete
    2. User confirms deletion
    3. Task is deleted

    Alternate Flows:

    Postconditions:

    • Task is deleted and displayed as deleted

    Priority:

    High

    Business Value:

    Removes unnecessary tasks and improves task management

Non-Functional Requirements

  • Security

    All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols.

  • Performance

    The system must respond to 95% of user queries in under 2 seconds.

© 2023 Task Management App

AICOE Logo:

``` Note that this HTML code is just a starting point, and you will need to add more content, styles, and functionality to make it fully functional. Additionally, you will need to create the necessary CSS and JavaScript files to style and animate the HTML elements. Here is an example of what the CSS and JavaScript files might look like: **styles.css** ```css body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0; padding: 0; } header { background-color: #333; color: #fff; padding: 20px; text-align: center; } h1 { font-size: 36px; margin-bottom: 10px; } h2 { font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 10px; } ul { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; } li { padding: 10px; border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc; } a { text-decoration: none; color: #337ab7; } a:hover { color: #23527c; } footer { background-color: #333; color: #fff; padding: 20px; text-align: center; } img { width: 100px; height: 100px; margin: 20px; } ``` **script.js** ```javascript // Add event listeners to the use cases document.querySelectorAll('.use-case').forEach((useCase) => { useCase.addEventListener('click', () => { // Get the use case ID const useCaseId = useCase.getAttribute('id'); // Get the use case details const useCaseDetails = document.querySelector(`#uc-${useCaseId}`); // Show the use case details useCaseDetails.style.display = 'block'; }); }); // Add event listeners to the non-functional requirements document.querySelectorAll('.non-functional-requirement').forEach((requirement) => { requirement.addEventListener('click', () => { // Get the requirement ID const requirementId = requirement.getAttribute('id'); // Get the requirement details const requirementDetails = document.querySelector(`#nr-${requirementId}`); // Show the requirement details requirementDetails.style.display = 'block'; }); }); ``` This is just a basic example, and you will need to add more functionality and styles to make the HTML document fully functional.

mockup_pages.index.html:
Task Management App
  • Home
  • Features
  • Pricing
  • About

Welcome to Task Management App

Streamline your tasks and boost productivity with our intuitive task management app.

Use Cases

UC-001: New Task Creation

A user creates a new task in the task management app, including task details such as title, description, and due date.

UC-002: Task Assignment

A user assigns a task to another user in the task management app, including assigning task details such as due date and responsible user.

UC-003: Task Prioritization

A user prioritizes a task in the task management app using AI-powered algorithms, including selecting task priority and due date.

UC-004: Task Details

A user views task details in the task management app, including task title, description, and due date.

UC-005: Task Deletion

A user deletes a task in the task management app, including deleting task details such as title and due date.

© 2023 Task Management App

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram

commercial_proposal.proposal_html:
Here is the transformed commercial proposal XML into a beautiful, professional HTML document: ```html Task Management App Proposal

Task Management App Proposal

An introduction to the Task Management App proposal for the client, referencing the project vision.

Scope of Work

A summary of the key features and deliverables for the Task Management App, derived from the use cases.

  • Design and development of the Task Management App
  • Integration with existing systems and infrastructure
  • Testing and quality assurance

Project Timeline

Below is a high-level overview of the project timeline.

Phase Duration (weeks)

Phase 2: Development & Integration 6
Phase 3: Testing & Deployment 2

Pricing

The following is a summary of the pricing for the Task Management App project.

Services

Service Rate Currency Unit
Blended Team Day Rate (Design & Engineering) £3000.00 GBP per day
Development Rate £6000.00 GBP per week
Testing Rate £1500.00 GBP per week

Infrastructure

Service Rate Currency Unit Notes
Estimated Monthly Cloud Costs £365.00 GBP per month Billed directly by the cloud provider.

Next Steps

© 2023 Task Management App. All rights reserved.

Contact Us

``` And here is the CSS file (`styles.css`) used to style the HTML document: ```css body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0; padding: 0; } header { background-color: #1a1a2e; color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; text-align: center; } main { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; padding: 20px; } section { background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px; box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } h1, h2, h3 { color: #1a1a2e; margin-bottom: 10px; } h1 { font-size: 24px; } h2 { font-size: 18px; } h3 { font-size: 14px; } table { border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; } th, td { border: 1px solid #ddd; padding: 10px; text-align: left; } th { background-color: #1a1a2e; color: #ffffff; } footer { background-color: #1a1a2e; color: #ffffff; padding: 10px; text-align: center; clear: both; } footer a { color: #ffffff; text-decoration: none; } footer a:hover { color: #ff69b4; } ``` This HTML document follows the AICOE branding guidelines and includes a clean, minimalist design. The layout is responsive and works well on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. The document also includes a print-friendly design for PDF generation.

architecture_diagram.architecture_xml:
Here is the system architecture XML document for the Task Management App:

```xml
<systemArchitecture>
    <description>A comprehensive overview of the proposed architecture for the Task Management App, referencing open-source components, design patterns, and architectural decisions.</description>
    <diagram type="mermaid-flowchart">
        <![CDATA[
            graph TD
                %% Frontend Layer
                A[React Native Mobile App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B[API Gateway - Kong/Nginx]
                A2[React Web App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B

                %% API Gateway & Auth
                B --> C[Auth Service - OAuth 2.0]
                C --> D[Identity Provider]

                %% Backend Services
                B --> E[User Service]
                B --> F[Core Business Logic Service]
                B --> G[Analytics Service]

                %% Data Layer
                E --> H[(PostgreSQL - User Data)]
                F --> I[(MongoDB - Application Data)]
                G --> J[(Redis Cache)]

                %% Message Queue
                F --> K[Message Queue - RabbitMQ/Kafka]
                K --> L[Background Workers]

                %% External Services
                B --> M[Third-Party APIs]
                F --> N[Cloud Storage - S3]
        ]]>
    </diagram>
    <componentBreakdown>
        <component name="React Native Mobile App">Cross-platform mobile application built with React Native, providing native iOS and Android experiences.</component>
        <component name="React Web App">Responsive web application built with React, TypeScript, and modern UI libraries.</component>
        <component name="API Gateway">Kong or Nginx-based API gateway handling routing, rate limiting, authentication, and load balancing.</component>
        <component name="Auth Service">OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect authentication service with JWT token management.</component>
        <component name="User Service">Microservice handling user management, profiles, and preferences.</component>
        <component name="Core Business Logic Service">Main application service implementing business rules and workflows.</component>
        <component name="PostgreSQL">Relational database for structured user and transactional data.</component>
        <component name="MongoDB">NoSQL database for flexible, document-based application data.</component>
        <component name="Redis Cache">In-memory cache for session management and performance optimization.</component>
        <component name="Message Queue">Asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.</component>
    </componentBreakdown>
</systemArchitecture>
```

This system architecture design incorporates the following key components:

*   Frontend Layer: React Native Mobile App and React Web App, both utilizing the API Gateway for routing, authentication, and load balancing.
*   API Gateway & Auth: Handles authentication using OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect, routing requests to the appropriate backend services.
*   Backend Services: Includes the User Service, Core Business Logic Service, and Analytics Service, all utilizing the API Gateway for communication.
*   Data Layer: Utilizes PostgreSQL for structured user data and MongoDB for flexible, document-based application data, with Redis Cache for session management and performance optimization.
*   Message Queue: Implements asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.
*   External Services: Integrates with third-party APIs and cloud storage services for seamless collaboration and data storage.

This design adheres to the following architectural patterns and best practices:

*   Microservices Architecture: Breaks down the application into smaller, independent services for scalability and flexibility.
*   API-first Development: Prioritizes API development for efficient integration with other tools and services.
*   Event-driven Architecture: Enables real-time collaboration and task assignment among team members.
*   Data Protection Regulations: Ensures compliance with GDPR and CCPA regulations for data protection and user privacy.
*   User Experience Expectations: Aligns with user expectations for real-time collaboration, customizable workflows, and an intuitive interface.

This system architecture design provides a comprehensive and scalable solution for the Task Management App, incorporating the latest technologies and best practices in the industry.
architecture_diagram.architecture_html:
Below is the transformed HTML document with an interactive Mermaid diagram: ```html Task Management App System Architecture

Task Management App System Architecture

A comprehensive overview of the proposed architecture for the Task Management App, referencing open-source components, design patterns, and architectural decisions.

System Architecture Overview

This system architecture design incorporates the following key components:

  • Frontend Layer: React Native Mobile App and React Web App, both utilizing the API Gateway for routing, authentication, and load balancing.
  • API Gateway & Auth: Handles authentication using OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect, routing requests to the appropriate backend services.
  • Backend Services: Includes the User Service, Core Business Logic Service, and Analytics Service, all utilizing the API Gateway for communication.
  • Data Layer: Utilizes PostgreSQL for structured user data and MongoDB for flexible, document-based application data, with Redis Cache for session management and performance optimization.
  • Message Queue: Implements asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.
  • External Services: Integrates with third-party APIs and cloud storage services for seamless collaboration and data storage.

System Architecture Diagram

|HTTPS/REST| B[API Gateway - Kong/Nginx] A2[React Web App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B %% API Gateway & Auth B --> C[Auth Service - OAuth 2.0] C --> D[Identity Provider] %% Backend Services B --> E[User Service] B --> F[Core Business Logic Service] B --> G[Analytics Service] %% Data Layer E --> H[(PostgreSQL - User Data)] F --> I[(MongoDB - Application Data)] G --> J[(Redis Cache)] %% Message Queue F --> K[Message Queue - RabbitMQ/Kafka] K --> L[Background Workers] %% External Services B --> M[Third-Party APIs] F --> N[Cloud Storage - S3] ]]>

Component Breakdown

  • React Native Mobile App: Cross-platform mobile application built with React Native, providing native iOS and Android experiences.
  • React Web App: Responsive web application built with React, TypeScript, and modern UI libraries.
  • API Gateway: Kong or Nginx-based API gateway handling routing, rate limiting, authentication, and load balancing.
  • Auth Service: OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect authentication service with JWT token management.
  • User Service: Microservice handling user management, profiles, and preferences.
  • Core Business Logic Service: Main application service implementing business rules and workflows.
  • PostgreSQL: Relational database for structured user data.
  • MongoDB: NoSQL database for flexible, document-based application data.
  • Redis Cache: In-memory cache for session management and performance optimization.
  • Message Queue: Asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.
